intro: Guatteria turrialbana, commonly known as the Turrialba guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and elliptical in shape, with a glossy surface. The flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in umbels, followed by dark blue-black berries that are edible.
